title: Anyone else finding the new Recommended items really annoying?
body:
Not long ago the 'Recommended' items on several champions were changed, and they just seem weird now.

No RoA on Ivern or Sol anymore.
Sol starts corrupting instead of Dorans 
Taliyah has morellos as an essential 
No phantom dancer on Kalista anymore.

Anyone know why the items suddenly changed? and why they got rid of all the ones we are used to building?

I now have to search for dorans ring... _(I should not have to search for the first item in the game, at the start of every single game)_
I also should not have to search for RoA on two champs that have it as their core.

Maybe if there was some logic to it, it might be easier, but RoA has been essential on Sol since he came out, and now it's replaced by the blue hextech item, _(now i could understand riot changing it, if all the pros built it (cos we know their obsession with faker), but in worlds they were always building the proto-belt, NOT the blue one..)_ so "cos the pros did it" cant even be the reason.

Taliyah is a tanky bursty disrupter with **low** mana costs and **short** cooldowns who needs to keep some distance in order to be at her most effective (she isnt a dueler like LB)... So an item that gives you **mana** and **CDR** with a dueling passive, is in no way 'essential' on her.. RoA and Rylais maybe.. but not morellos.

There is no logic to these changes, and if there is, it is so far over my skill level that i cant even see it.

And to make it worse, you cant even revert these changes by making your own custom item sets _(even if you make them in the old client, but play in the new one, it still doesn't work.)_

Has anyone else experienced weird changes to their 'Recommended' items?

replies.body:
Let me just go through some of my thoughts:

1. Corrupting is a solid starting item on Sol, not only because of the compensation for the amount of mana he uses hard pushing the wave at Level 1, but also synergies with his W with early poke and trades.
2. Unless you are mixed up between the two, I'm not sure where you got Hextech Protobelt-01 from. Since the mana cost nerfs on Sol, giving him a Hextech GLP-800 over RoA is pretty nifty, since you get the mana of a full stacked RoA
3. When you say tanky, I think you mean sustainable.
4. Morellonomicon is an essential starting item on most mages right now; with 100 AP and CDR, what better could you asked for (and you get the CDR for Taliyah's ult, 120 second cooldown at max rank)
5. You can just press "All Items" and find, you guessed it, all of the items you need.

My point is, they change the recommended items occasionally to fit the style of where the game is currently at, so you will probably see lots of changes like this in the future.

Why would you hard push the lane at lvl 1?
and why would it need mana?
Your normal stars are more than enough to last hit minions, and if you're good you can do it without touching the other minions.
You only want to be pushing the lane at lvl 6+ so you can roam, do it before that and you open yourself up to needless ganks _(and sol doesnt like ganks)_

And Dorans gives you more damage in trades than corrupting potion.
Your normal Q/W/Thunderlords combo, takes between 1/3 and 1/2 of their HP in a single trade and all you need for that is 1 Q and 2 stars _(so it doesn't use much mana)_
if you just sit there with W on all the time, then sure you'll use up mana, but who does that?

and no, the pros definitely used Protobelt in worlds _(i watched very carefully)_.

And morellos isn't that essential, maybe on people like Syndra and LB it is, but not on Azir/Sol/Taliyah, they have other items they need to rush in order to be effective.

Yea obviously all items has all the items in it (No fricken way!!!) but you still have to trawl through all the items to find what youre looking for.

and no, i mean tanky.
Sustainable refers to champs like Soraka or Swain, who can sustain their lives without needing HP
when you have this much HP:

http://imgur.com/a/ke0le

Pretty sure you fit more into the tanky side of things.

even though control wards are a less valuable version of the vision ward, I don't like how riot is like 'yeah we fucked up vision wards, so we won't bother including control wards in the recommended item pages anymore anyway since they're bad and players should just forget about the fact we removed the only item that could save you from a fed stealth assassin'.

> [{quoted}](name=Nightjar,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=8mQyztql,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-11-28T02:11:21.903+0000)
>
> even though control wards are a less valuable version of the vision ward, I don't like how riot is like 'yeah we fucked up vision wards, so we won't bother including control wards in the recommended item pages anymore anyway since they're bad and players should just forget about the fact we removed the only item that could save you from a fed stealth assassin'.

um... they **are** in the recommended pages... and what are so 'bad' about them? They do the exact same job as Visions and for a bonus, they all disable nearby wards and traps.

 **And** reveal Camoflaged units.

**And** you can have 3 at a time in your inventory.

Please feel free to tell me why they are "bad"

firstly they're worse than vision wards since now I don't really have a way to deal with a fed khazix and I'm salty because I miss vision wards.

Secondly, some of the pages just got updated but still for over half the champions, they still haven't updated the recommended item pages to have control wards in them and it makes them irritating to remember to buy since previously, almost every single riot recommended page had vision wards in them.

Tbh this wouldn't have bothered me as much if they hadn't removed recommended item sets, so it's not like I can just make my own pages and include them (without having to use the legacy client and even then the updates on item sets sometimes don't show on the new client).

Eh I wouldn't complain about it, sounds rather good to me.
Now you'll definitely know the green horns from the people who actually play a champion.

I just wish Rito did something to make people want to actually work on their item builds instead of copying whatever they see a pro use.

Taliyah has morellos because  people bought it on her in well over 60% of games, and riot took that as a popular item, and considering most people ended up replacing the ROA with morellos anyway, they decided to just take ROA out and put morellos in, blame the taliyah playerbase not riot.
